abstract.p: The Source Code Browser consists of two parts, an indexer program and an extractor program. The indexer need only be run infrequently (when the source code collection changes), and the extractor can be run to extract a source file by file- or function-name, either in plain text to the command line, or in HTML including hyperlinks to called routines, viewable using a WWW browser. In the latter case, the extractor program must be installed as a CGI script.

copyright.name: Council for the Central Laboratory of the Research Councils
